item.title: Adiós gringo
item.description: Adiós gringo is a 1965 Italian Spaghetti Western directed by Giorgio Stegani. Its stars Giuliano Gemma and was co produced between Italy, Spain and France. On release in the United States, nearly all of the cast members and production team had their names changed for the English audience. A major success, it was the 4th highest grossing picture of the year in Italy.

item.title: Blood for a Silver Dollar
item.description: Blood for a Silver Dollar, also known as One Silver Dollar, is a 1965 Italian-French Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Ferroni, written by Giorgio Stegani and Ferroni and starring Giuliano Gemma and Ida Galli.

item.title: Django Shoots First
item.description: Django Shoots First is an Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Alberto De Martino.

item.title: Perché uccidi ancora
item.description: Perché uccidi ancora is a 1965 Italian western film adventure directed by José Antonio de la Loma and Edoardo Mulargia.

item.title: Heroes of Fort Worth
item.description: Heroes of Fort Worth or Gli eroi di Fort Worth is a 1965 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Alberto De Martino.

item.title: Chuck Moll
item.description: Chuck Moll is a 1970 Italian spaghetti western. The film represents the directorial debut of Enzo Barboni, who was, until then, a respected cinematographer. He replaced Ferdinando Baldi, who was fired by the producer Manolo Bolognini because of his insistence in wanting to engage the actress Annabella Incontrera in the role of Sheila.

item.title: Gatling Gun
item.description: Gatling Gun is a 1968 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Paolo Bianchini and starring Robert Woods.

item.title: Man Called Invincible
item.description: Man Called Invincible is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.
